intro: Fragaria breslingea, commonly known as the Bresling strawberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to the highlands of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are typically red in color and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in cool, moist climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
